Hi,

In my project, I have to invoke the test suite indirectly through a batch/shell 
script, using the Ant/Maven "exec" target in some scenarios.

The problem is that when I have test failures (not errors), the build shows 
Successful even though I have failonerror=true for the exec target.  In other 
words, failures still return a good return code from java/exec.  I can visually 
see the failures print, but this doesn't work if I want to automate my builds 
and failure reports.

What would be the best way to make failures cause the build to fail?  Should I 
catch the test failure in the tearDown() of each test, and throw a runtime 
exception?  Wouldn't this mask my failures when I run the tests through normal 
means (single test through IDE, for example)?

Any ideas on how to resolve this?

Thanks,
Chad

P.S.  If you are wondering why I have to use exec, this is because I am using a
custom batch/shell script to set up the framework for the app.  My app is an AOP
test framework, and I am providing examples of using the AspectWerkz'
"transparentbootclasspath" option under JDK 1.3:
http://aspectwerkz.codehaus.org/online.html#Transparent%20bootclasspath
